award_name.ja: 産業応用特別賞 貢献賞〔電気学会産業応用部門〕

paper_title.en: Single-switch electronic ballast with a boost-type converter applied to hid lamps

description.en: Recent developments in HID (High Intensity Discharge) lamps have increasingly been attracting interest due to their highly efficient operation and excellent color characteristics. This paper presents a novel type of electronic ballast for HID lamps. The key feature of the circuit topology is the application of a boost-type converter. The proposed circuit is very simple. It is composed of a capacitor, reactors, an output transformer, and a switching device IGBT (Insulated Gate Bipolar Transistor). A 70 W metal-halide lamp (an HID lamp) is used in this circuit. The performance characteristics of this proposed electronic ballast are described in this paper. Based on the theoretical and experimental results, the proposed circuit is suitable for the HID lamps.

paper_title.en: A novel electronic ballast for HID lamps using a boost-type converter

description.en: Recent developments in HID (High Intensity Discharge) lamps have increasingly been attracting interest due to their highly efficient operation and excellent color characteristics. This paper presents a novel type of solid-state electronic ballast for the HID lamps. The key feature of the circuit topology is the application of a boost-type converter. The proposed circuit is very simple, where is composed of a capacitor, reactors, an output transformer, and a switching device IGBT (Insulated Gate Bipolar Transistor). A 70 W metal-halide lamp (an HID lamp) is used in this circuit. The performance characteristics of this proposed electronic ballast are described in this paper. Based on the theoretical and experimental results, the proposed ballast circuit is suitable for the HID lamps.

paper_title.en: Activities of the IEC SC22H(Uninterruptible Power Systems)
DC ripple current reduction on a single-phase PWM voltage-source rectifier

description.en: A no, el topology of single-phase pulsewidth modulation (PWM) voltage-source rectifier capable of achieving not only a sinusoidal input current, but also a zero-ripple output current, is presented. The rectifier consists of a conventional single-phase PWM voltage-source rectifier, a pair of additional switches, and an inductor. Hence, the proposed rectifier requires neither a large de capacitor nor a passive GC resonant circuit. The input current control is achieved by the conventional PWM current control technique. However, de ripple current reduction control is difficult because one of the switching legs in the de ripple current reduction circuit is shared with the PWM rectifier circuit, Two control methods, referred to here as the de C inductor method and the ac inductor method, are proposed for de ripple reduction, and the characteristics of these control methods are discussed. These control methods are implemented using a microprocessor, and the effectiveness of the circuit is confirmed experimentally, This rectifier has useful applications in uninterruptible power systems and de power supplies, especially for cases in which the batteries are connected in parallel to the de line.
